page.title: 01Around Windrush Airfield
page.content: This area is gently undulating Cotswold hill land, very free draining and devoid of water courses. The fields are generally large and many are boarded by walls built of the local; stone, traces of quarrying remain.Long established woods are few but there are several recent plantations of conifers. Farm buildings are scattered over this area, the older ones stone built, others recently constructed, of modern materials; all the remaining land being used for growing barley, wheat and grass. Human habitation is sparce, only thirteen dwellings in the whole area.Remains of a wartime airfield, comprising the tarmac perimiter and track.Some of the old buildings are in the centre of this block of land.An ancient encampment is here & is the only one not ploughed.
